snippet: Senators are seamlessly reversing stances on filibusters and obstructionism depending on which party is in the majority and who holds the White House.
abstract: Carl Hulse On Washington column notes Republican Sen Orrin G Hatch and Democratic Sen Chuck Schumer are engaged in their second battle over on president's Supreme Court nominee; Schumer, who tried to obstruct Pres George W Bush's nomination of Miguel Estrada in 2003, has switched positions and is decrying Hatch's attempt to block Pres Obama's nomination; situation demonstrates both sides' willingness to use ruthless tactics to block nominees of opposing party.
lead_paragraph: Senators are seamlessly reversing stances on filibusters and obstructionism depending on which party is in the majority and who holds the White House.

headline.main: Senators Limber Up for a Dexterous Flip on Judicial Nominees
headline.print_headline: A Senate Renowned for Its Dexterous Flips on Court Nominations
